business.headline: Tata History: When Nehru, Jinnah, and Bose allied to save steel companyStarting as a company trading in cotton and opium, the Tata Group has weathered colonial economic warfare, nationalist politics, labor upheaval, and insurgent crises. But it has always emerged stronger through vision, sacrifice, and resilience. In the final episode of our series on the group, we revisit two storms that threatened to sink the Tata brand and image.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as financial stocks rally; Cipla, SBI among top gainersSensex ends 328 points higher, Nifty above 25,250; Cipla, SBI lead gains

Convenience or debt trap? The hidden cost of BPNL, easy credit and festive offersEvery festive season, easy credit makes everything—from gadgets to holidays—look affordable. But behind the glitter of BNPL schemes and "no-cost EMIs" lies a growing debt trap that's quietly eroding financial freedom.

Tata Trusts trustee Vijay Singh calls internal rift unprecedented: ReportVijay Singh, who serves as a trustee and vice-chairman of Tata Trusts, said that the act of voting on internal matters went against the long-standing principles followed during Ratan Tata's leadership.

WeWork India slips 5% in debut trade amid valuation, governance concernsCorporate governance firm InGovern warned investors of WeWork India's fragile financials, negative cash flow, high lease liabilities, and the absence of fresh capital infusion.

Buy, borrow, die: The wealth cheat code the rich don't share, explains CAEver wondered how wealthy families keep growing their wealth while others struggle with taxes and inflation? CA reveals a simple three-step strategy: Buy, Borrow, Die. Have a look.

LG Electronics IPO GMP touches Rs 400: Here's how to check allotment statusLG IPO: The GMP is an indicator of market sentiment, showing the expected difference between the IPO price and the likely listing price. With the upper price band set at Rs 1,140, a GMP of Rs 400 suggests the shares could debut at around Rs 1,540, implying potential listing gains of roughly 35%.
TCS reports 20,000 layoffs, employees' advocacy group questions transparencyThe IT giant's employee strength fell from 6,13,069 on June 30 to 5,93,314, according to Q2FY26 data posted on its website.

Stopping PF contributions? What it means for your retirement savingsPausing your PF contributions may seem harmless, but it can slow down your retirement savings. Even if your money stays safe, missing deposits could mean losing valuable interest and tax benefits over time.

What's brewing at Bira 91? Over 250 employees seek removal of founder, says reportEmployees cited "corporate governance failure, lack of transparency, delays in salaries and dues," as well as cases filed by creditors indicating deteriorating financials and pending vendor payments.

Tata Capital IPO vs LG IPO GMP: Which one is likely to give better returns? Tata Capital's IPO, priced between Rs 310–Rs 326, shows modest grey market premiums of Rs 6–Rs 7, indicating limited listing gains. LG Electronics India's IPO, at Rs 1,140, boasts Rs 380 GMP, suggesting strong upside.

Bitcoin slips again. 3 reasons why the crypto market is downBitcoin's price has slipped again this week, signalling renewed volatility in the digital asset space. From rising US inflation worries to ETF outflows, here's what's dragging crypto prices lower.

The legacy of Tata Trusts, beyond the boardroomTata Trusts is one of India's oldest, largest, and most influential philanthropic foundations.  A group of public charitable trusts set up by members of the Tata family, the present-day Trusts trace their origin to the working-class-focused JN Endowment Fund, started by Jamsetji Tata.
Sensex, Nifty trade higher after flat start as banks lead gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 232.01 points to 82,404.11, while the NSE Nifty50 added 70.60 points to 25,252.40 as of 9:32 am.

UK PM Keir Starmer calls Paytm the 'Superstar' of Indian fintech industryUK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said that the rise of Indian fintech companies on the world stage driven by technological innovation, digital inclusion, and entrepreneurial scale.

LG Electronics IPO allotment live: Check status online, GMP surges ahead of listingLG Electronics IPO closed for bidding on Thursday, created a record by attracting bids worth Rs 4.4 lakh crore, making it the most subscribed IPO in India by value.

Tata Trusts board meets today amid internal turmoil: Here's what to expectThe board meeting follows days of internal disagreement and comes just a day after the first death anniversary of Ratan N. Tata, the former chairman who led the Trusts for several decades until his death last year.

Hidden in fine print: The clause that lets insurers quietly increase your premiumA little-known "Material Change" clause in health policies lets insurers increase premiums or restrict coverage after a claim. However, policyholders can challenge such actions to safeguard renewability and long-term benefits.

US sanctions over 50 entities, including Indians, over links to Iran oil tradeAmong those sanctioned are Varun Pula, Soniya Shrestha, and Iyappan Raja, all Indian nationals accused of facilitating shipments of Iranian oil and LPG.

7 alternative ways to diversify your portfolio this DiwaliAs Diwali approaches, many are thinking about not just celebrations but also financial planning. Diversifying your portfolio across multiple assets can help manage risk and make your money work harder in the long run.

entertainment.headline: Francia Raisa saved Selena Gomez's life, yet missed her wedding. Here's why Actor Francia Raisa has spoken about long-standing rumours of a fallout with singer-actor Selena Gomez. In a recent interview, she commented on speculation about her missing Gomez's wedding despite saving her life in 2017.

Exclusive: Sultaan on new album; working with Diljit Dosanjh, Jazzy B and Eminem Punjabi rapper Sultaan is set to release the final chapter of his 'Rap God' album after nearly four years of work. The album marks his musical growth and features a notable collaboration with Diljit Dosanjh, highlighting the rise of hip hop in India.

How Jisoo became the beating heart of South Korea's pop culture In this week's K-fix, we discover how Jisoo evolved from Blackpink idol to global icon, conquering music, acting, and fashion while leaving her mark on South Korea's pop culture.

Idli Kadai deserves tax exemption: BJP spokesperson urges Tamil Nadu government BJP spokesperson ANS Prasad urged the Tamil Nadu government to grant tax exemption to 'Idli Kadai'. He praised the film's focus on culture, non-violence, and traditional values.

Shah Bano's daughter sends legal notice to Emraan Hashmi, Yami Gautam's Haq Shah Bano's daughter has sent a legal notice to 'Haq' makers for unauthorised depiction of Shah Bano's personal life without her consent. Bano's daughter, Siddiqua Begum, is the surviving legal heir.

Veduvan review: Kanna Ravi's sincere act falls short in rushed crime dramaRelease Date:Fri Oct 10, 2025 Veduvan review: 'Veduvan' on Zee5 follows Sooraj, an actor researching a cop with a controversial past. The series explores the emotional and ethical challenges behind encounter killings in police work.

Kantara Chapter 1 crosses Rs 500 crore at global box office, set to challenge KGF 2 Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' storms the global box office, crossing Rs 500 crore worldwide in its first week. Backed by Hombale Films, the prequel to the 2022 blockbuster sets new benchmarks for Kannada cinema and eyes 'KGF 2's' record.

Will Andrew Garfield return as Spider-Man in Avengers: Doomsday? Actor clarifies Actor Andrew Garfield reacted to the claims about as Spider-Man in the upcoming 'Avengers: Doomsday'. The actor had earlier denied his appearance in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home', but had featured in the film alongside Tobey Maguire and Tom Holland.

Hrithik to produce Storm for Prime Video with Parvathy, Alaya F, Saba Azad Prime Video has announced a new thriller drama series titled 'Storm', produced by Hrithik Roshan. The series features a lead cast that includes Parvathy Thiruvothu, Alaya F, Srishti Shrivastava, Rrama Sharma, and Saba Azad.

One Battle After Another, Demon Slayer Infinity Castle climbs into IMDb's Top 250 'Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Movie: Infinity Castle' and Paul Thomas Anderson's 'One Battle After Another' secure places in IMDb's prestigious Top 250 list. These films are not only dominating the global box office but also winning hearts with their stellar performances and critical acclaim.

Dude producer reacts to Kiran Abbavaram's screen shortage claims in Tamil Nadu 'Dude' producer Ravi Shankar addressed actor Kiran Abbavaram's concerns about fewer screens for Telugu films in Tamil Nadu. He discussed screen distribution during festivals with respect to quality content.

Kurukshetra review: Gulzar's stunning narration overshadowed by weak voiceoversRelease Date:Fri Oct 10, 2025 Netflix's Kurukshetra revisits the Mahabharata through the eyes of 18 warriors. The series highlights timeless moral dilemmas and internal battles relevant today.

Brad Pitt's F1 races past 100 days in cinemas, still running strong in India 'F1: The Movie' has successfully completed 100 days in Indian cinemas, grossing over Rs 100 crore and captivating audiences with its thrilling motorsport drama. Featuring Brad Pitt, the film continues to enjoy high demand.

Tron Ares review: Jared Leto's film is a flashy yet hollow return to the gridRelease Date:Fri Oct 10, 2025 'Tron: Ares' returns after 15 years with a high-tech spectacle but shallow storytelling. The film's corporate focus and emotional detachment raise questions about rebooting classic sci-fi for today's audience.

Parag Tyagi's new post for Shefali Jariwala feels like a letter sent to heaven Parag Tyagi shared heartfelt messages and videos remembering his late wife Shefali Jariwala. The actor announces the dedication of his social media accounts to Shefali and her foundation.

TXT's Huening Kai shuts girlfriend rumours, opens up about trust and privacy Huening Kai of Tomorrow X Together clarifies rumours about a late-night meeting with a woman after online speculation. The singer issued public apologies to fans, staff, and teammates, emphasising honesty over rumours.

After Deepika, Hansal Mehta slams industry burnout: Exhaustion has been normalised Hansal Mehta joined the league of stars who slammed exhausting working hours in the film industry. In his lengthy post on X, the filmmaker stated how daily wage-workers bear the brunt of the shifts.

Mercy trailer: Chris Pratt races against time, Rebecca Ferguson is AI executioner Actor Chris Pratt plays a detective accused of murdering his wife in Mercy. The film explores AI as judge and executioner, raising questions about justice and technology.

Hamnet trailer: Paul Mescal and Jessie Buckley bring Shakespeare's grief to life Chloe Zhao's upcoming film 'Hamnet' offers a poignant portrayal of William Shakespeare as a grieving father, drawing from Maggie O'Farrell's acclaimed novel. The period drama has already been acclaimed at international festivals.

general news.headline: Venezuelan Maria Corina Machado beats Trump to Nobel Peace PrizeMaria Corina Machado, known as Venezuela's Iron Lady for her work in promoting democratic rights, has been in hiding following last year's election widely seen as having been rigged by Nicolas Maduro.

Afghan soil won't be used against any country, Taliban minister assures IndiaAfghan Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi, after meeting External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar in New Delhi, assured that Afghanistan will not allow its territory to be used against any country.

What do Trump and Nobel Peace Prize winner Maria Corina Machado have in common?Venezuela's larger-than-life leader, Maduro, who walked out of Hugo Chavez's shadow at the start of last decade, now faces a big headache - at home with Maria Corina Machado and abroad with Donald Trump.

Islamabad turns fortress amid Labbaik's US embassy march, 2 killed in violencePakistan's capital, Islamabad, remains tense after security personnel clashed with members of far-right outfit, Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan's (TLP) in Lahore. Lakhs of TLP men attempted to march to the US Embassy in Islamabad. Containers and barricades have been put up, and the internet has been shut. The violence in the protest-march for Palestine, which will continue on Friday, left two dead and dozens injured.

Was Aurangzeb India's true unifier?Pakistan minister Khawaja Asif said India was "never truly united except under Aurangzeb". Did the sixth Mughal emperor, under whom the dynasty reached the zenith of territorial dominance, indeed unify India? What's the historical fact?

Day 1 Live: Gill and Jaiswal steady after Sudharsan exitIND vs WI Live score, 2nd Test Day 1: Almost a redemption hundred for Sai Sudharsan, but not enough as he was dismissed for 87. A brilliant second wicket stand between Yashasvi Jaiswal and Sudharsan has kept India in firm control of the match despite the dismissal.

Gaza ceasefire in effect, announces Israeli military; troops being relocatedThe ceasefire came into effect at noon Israel time (2.30 pm IST). The initial de-escalation is part of a 20-point peace plan proposed by US President Donald Trump.

Yesterday, today and tomorrow: Pak minister says Afghans have always backed IndiaKhawaja Asif's remarks come as Afghanistan Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi visits India, the first such high-level trip since the Taliban's 2021 takeover.
Field Marshal Munir's tetra-crisisTwin threats from India and Afghanistan and twin insurgencies raging within, why Field Marshal Munir has his hands full.

Assam hunts for a villain after losing its hero Zubeen GargAssam's grief over Zubeen Garg's death has turned into an untamed quest for blame. Rumours are sharpening the hunt for a villain to fill the void left by its beloved bard. This has echoes of the hunt for a culprit after the death of Sushant Singh Rajput in 2020.

Once a security guard at Zoho, now their techie. A senior employee spotted himIn his LinkedIn post that has now gone viral, Abdul Alim detailed his remarkable journey from hardship to success at Zoho, despite having no college degree.

Family of only Hindu captured by Hamas clings to hope as new video emergesBipin Joshi, who was working at a farm in southern Israel as part of a study program, was among those kidnapped by Hamas during its offensive in Israel on October 7, 2023.

Rohit Sharma flaunts his new Tesla, viral video grabs Elon Musk's attentionIndian cricket captain Rohit Sharma drove his new Tesla Model Y to a Mumbai award show, creating a social media sensation. The customised number plate and viral videos attracted Elon Musk's attention.

Kerala court confirms Sabarimala gold theft, orders SIT to submit report in 6 weeksKerala High Court directs state police to register a criminal case over gold misappropriation at Sabarimala. Court orders confidential investigation, asks SIT to submit report within six weeks, excluding government updates.

Who is Maria Corina Machado who won Nobel Peace Prize Trump is vying for?Maria Corina Machado, a Venezuelan politician, industrial engineer, and human rights advocate, has won the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize for her steadfast fight for democracy and human rights in Venezuela.

Pak panics? Strikes in Afghanistan as Taliban minister makes maiden India tripThe timing of the Pakistani attack, aimed to snuff out Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan chief Noor Wali Mehsud, coincided with the Taliban Foreign Minister's maiden visit to India. Is Pakistan rattled by India's Afghan outreach?

Just a protein shake for breakfast - Smart or shortcut gone wrong?In today's hustle culture, where slow mornings are a luxury and cooking feels like a chore, many turn to protein shakes as a convenient breakfast alternative. But do health experts approve of it?

From scissors to scams: How Jawed Habib became face of multi-crore crypto fraudHe was the man behind Bollywood's best hair, and now, one of the accused in Uttar Pradesh's biggest crypto scams. This is how celebrity hairstylist Jawed Habib, once a symbol of glamour and success, became the face of a fake Bitcoin scheme.

Trump does not get Nobel for 2025, but don't rule him out for 2026Trump has credited himself with ending 6–7 conflicts, including one between India and Pakistan. He has mostly attributed the resolutions to his personal diplomacy. However, the biggest reason Trump didn't get the Nobel Peace Prize this year is something else.

Watch: New Zealand Maori MP breaks into unplanned Haka, Speaker suspends HouseNew Zealand's parliamentary proceedings came to a halt when people in the public gallery broke into a haka, a traditional Maori dance, after the newest lawmaker from the Maori Party, Oriini Kaipara, finished her maiden speech on Thursday.
Prince William fights back tears as woman speaks about husband's suicidePrince William's Royal Foundation is contributing £1 million to launch a National Suicide Prevention Network.

Eye on Pak, India ramps up ties with Taliban, set to reopen Kabul embassyExternal Affairs Minister Jaishankar held a meeting with the Taliban foreign minister on Friday in what is being seen as the highest level of interaction between New Delhi and Kabul since Taliban took control of Afghanistan.

Who was Varinder Singh Ghuman, vegetarian bodybuilder and Salman Khan's co-star?Varinder Singh Ghuman, widely known as the world's first vegetarian bodybuilder, died due to a heart attack in Punjab. His family and representatives confirmed he sought hospital treatment for shoulder pain before his death.

Kolkata woman sprays pepper on passengers after seat dispute, hauled up. Video viralWhen a woman was unable to secure a seat on a local train in Kolkata, she pulled out a can of pepper spray and attempted to spray it in the other passengers' faces.

Bradley Cooper to join Margot Robbie for Ocean's Eleven prequelBradley Cooper is set to star alongside Margot Robbie in a new prequel to the iconic 'Oceans Eleven'. Directed by Lee Isaac Chung, it is set in 1960s Europe.

Francia Raisa saved Selena Gomez's life, yet missed her wedding. Here's whyActor Francia Raisa has spoken about long-standing rumours of a fallout with singer-actor Selena Gomez. In a recent interview, she commented on speculation about her missing Gomez's wedding despite saving her life in 2017.

sports.headline: IPL 2026 auction likely in December, retention deadline set for November: Report The IPL 2026 mini-auction is likely to be held in mid-December with player retentions due by November.

Mohsin Naqvi meets Pakistan players, motivates them before South Africa Tests PCB Chairman Mohsin Naqvi visited Gaddafi Stadium to motivate Pakistan's cricket team ahead of their Test series against South Africa and also met the South African team management.

Rohit trains at Mumbai's Shivaji Park, thousands of fans gather to watch star Rohit Sharma hit the nets at Shivaji Park in Mumbai as the former India captain continued his preparations for the upcoming Australia tour. Rohit was seen playing an array of shots as fans cheered him on.

IND vs WI: Sai Sudharsan silences critics with confident 87 in Delhi Test Sai Sudharsan silenced critics with a confident 87 in India's second Test against West Indies in New Delhi. His composed innings helped anchor a 193-run partnership with Yashasvi Jaiswal, easing pressure on his No. 3 spot.

Asia Cup still in Dubai, PCB chief says no trophy handover without his nod The Asia Cup trophy, refused by India from ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi after their win over Pakistan, remains locked at the ACC Dubai office with instructions that it cannot be handed over without his personal approval.

Kylian Mbappe urges no-probe in Lamine Yamal's personal life: He's just 18 Kylian Mbappe has defended Barcelona's Lamine Yamal, urging fans and media to stop scrutinising his personal life. The Real Madrid star emphasised that at 18, Yamal's focus should remain on football and growth.

WPL 2026 mega action set for November, RTM to make debut: Reports The WPL 2026 mega auction, likely to be held in late November, will mark a major reset for the league, with teams allowed to retain up to five players under a new retention framework. For the first time, franchises will also have access to the RTM option.

From caution to Jas-ball: Yashasvi Jaiswal hits classy century in Delhi Test vs WI Yashasvi Jaiswal struck a classy century in New Delhi, shifting gears from a slow start to full Jas-ball mode. His mature knock steadied India's innings and showcased his growing confidence in Test cricket.

Priyansh Arya earns maiden first-class call-up in Delhi squad for Ranji Trophy opener Ranji Trophy: Delhi have named a massive 24-member squad for their opening game against Hyderabad. Nitish Rana has been named skipper with Yash Dhull as his deputy.

Nadine de Klerk: The South African storm India never saw coming in Vizag Women's World Cup: In a match crackling with tension and shifting tides, South Africa's Nadine de Klerk delivered a knock for the ages to leave India stunned. Backing her training, her temperament, and her timing, Nadine sealed one of South Africa's most memorable World Cup victories.

WPL 2026 mega action set for November, RTM to make debut: Reports The WPL 2026 mega auction, likely to be held in late November, will mark a major reset for the league, with teams allowed to retain up to five players under a new retention framework. For the first time, franchises will also have access to the RTM option.

Priyansh Arya earns maiden first-class call-up in Delhi squad for Ranji Trophy opener Ranji Trophy: Delhi have named a massive 24-member squad for their opening game against Hyderabad. Nitish Rana has been named skipper with Yash Dhull as his deputy.

Nadine de Klerk: The South African storm India never saw coming in Vizag Women's World Cup: In a match crackling with tension and shifting tides, South Africa's Nadine de Klerk delivered a knock for the ages to leave India stunned. Backing her training, her temperament, and her timing, Nadine sealed one of South Africa's most memorable World Cup victories.

Rohit Sharma flaunts his new Tesla, viral video grabs Elon Musk's attentionIndian cricket captain Rohit Sharma drove his new Tesla Model Y to a Mumbai award show, creating a social media sensation. The customised number plate and viral videos attracted Elon Musk's attention.

Hardik Pandya spotted with rumoured girlfriend at Mumbai airport. Video goes viralIndian cricketer Hardik Pandya was spotted with rumoured girlfriend, Mahieka Sharma, at the Mumbai airport recently. The all-rounder has been out of competitive action since the Asia Cup final, which he missed due to an injury.

Pat Cummins in tight spot: Australia wary of skipper's injury risk before AshesAustralia coach Andrew McDonald said the team is closely monitoring Pat Cummins' recovery from a lower-back injury ahead of the Ashes, with the skipper needing to start bowling at least a month before the series.

Watch: Young fan touches MS Dhoni's feet at Madurai stadium inaugurationMS Dhoni inaugurated a new cricket stadium in Madurai on Thursday, and recieved a roaring welcome by fans. A young fan touching his feet became the highlight of the event, and the video has gone viral.

Richa Ghosh backs India's top-order despite SA loss: One match doesn't define themIndia batter Richa Ghosh emphasised that the side's top-order batters all have immense quality, and backed them amidst criticism for yet another let-down during their loss to South Africa in the Women's World Cup clash on October 9.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli expected to play domestic cricket in Dec-Jan: ReportRohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are expected to play in Vijay Hazare Trophy matches in December and January. The two greats will return to international cricket during an ODI series in Australia later in October.

Watch: Gautam Gambhir's priceless reaction as Shubman Gill wins first Test tossIndia vs West Indies, 2nd Test: After losing six tosses in a row as Test captain, Shubman Gill finally broke the duck in New Delhi. Head coach Gautam Gambhir and the Indian bowlers celebrated the win, sharing some playful banter with the skipper on Friday morning.

Richa Ghosh backs India's top-order despite SA loss: One match doesn't define themIndia batter Richa Ghosh emphasised that the side's top-order batters all have immense quality, and backed them amidst criticism for yet another let-down during their loss to South Africa in the Women's World Cup clash on October 9.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli expected to play domestic cricket in Dec-Jan: ReportRohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are expected to play in Vijay Hazare Trophy matches in December and January. The two greats will return to international cricket during an ODI series in Australia later in October.

Watch: Gautam Gambhir's priceless reaction as Shubman Gill wins first Test tossIndia vs West Indies, 2nd Test: After losing six tosses in a row as Test captain, Shubman Gill finally broke the duck in New Delhi. Head coach Gautam Gambhir and the Indian bowlers celebrated the win, sharing some playful banter with the skipper on Friday morning.

Weekend cricket hero: Arshdeep Singh's dad sends bowling stats, asks son to top themArshdeep Singh's light-hearted competition with his father adds a funny twist to his pre-match routine. The India pacer revealed how their weekend bowling "challenges" often gave him extra motivation before taking the field.

Day 1 Live: Gill and Jaiswal steady after Sudharsan exitIND vs WI Live score, 2nd Test Day 1: Almost a redemption hundred for Sai Sudharsan, but not enough as he was dismissed for 87. A brilliant second wicket stand between Yashasvi Jaiswal and Sudharsan has kept India in firm control of the match despite the dismissal.

India's flaws laid bare in Vizag: Misfiring top-order, left-arm spin bitesWomen's World Cup 2025: South Africa exposed India's major flaws with a thrilling three-wicket win in the Vizag clash: three consecutive top-order failures, persistent struggles against left-arm spin, and an inability to maintain a brisk scoring rate.

India vs West Indies 2nd Test predicted XI: Will Bumrah get rested in Delhi?India look to complete a 2-0 series victory over West Indies in Delhi. Team management may look to rest Jasprit Bumrah or Mohammed Siraj ahead of the South Africa Tests.

Nadine lost for words after pulling of incredible heist against India in VizagNadine de Klerk's unbeaten 84 helped South Africa chase down 252 against India in a thrilling World Cup match. The win ended their five-match losing streak against India and revived their campaign after an early setback.

IND vs SA: Harmanpreet Kaur rues India's batting frailty after South Africa lossIndia captain Harmanpreet Kaur rued the batting woes of her side as they slumped to a 3-wicket loss to South Africa in Vizag on Thursday, October 9. India's top and middle-order issues were exposed again by South Africa.

Nadine's sensational 84 trumps Richa's 94 as South Africa stun India in VizagWomen's World Cup: Richa Ghosh's stunning 94 went in vain as Nadine de Klerk powered South Africa to a three-wicket win, ending India's imperfect unbeaten run in the group clash at the ACA–VDCA Cricket Stadium.

How New Zealand plans to tackle Bangladesh's spin threat? Amelia Kerr explainsAmelia Kerr said that New Zealand are wary of the spin threat posed by Bangladesh and explained how they plan to tackle it during their clash on Friday, October 10 in Guwahati. New Zealand are chasing their first win of the tournament.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
